decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful combat spells. By curving out with efficient creatures like Giant Killer, Rimrock Knight, and Lovestruck Beast, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain board presence. Goldspan Dragon and Embercleave provide additional burst damage potential to close out games quickly. Showdown of the Skalds helps refill the hand and keep up the aggression. The deck also includes versatile spells like Sejiri Shelter and Kazuul's Fury to protect its key creatures and push for lethal damage.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and slowing down the opponent's game plan through a combination of removal spells and counterspells. It also aims to generate card advantage and ramp up its mana to cast powerful late-game threats. With Yorion as the companion, the deck can flicker its permanents for additional value. The deck includes a mix of creatures, spells, and enchantments to provide a versatile and flexible control strategy. Overall, the key concept is to outvalue and outlast the opponent while setting up a win condition with powerful spells and creatures.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on generating card advantage and controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and powerful threats like Elder Gargaroth and Emergent Ultimatum. The deck also includes Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion for additional value. The deck aims to control the board with spells like Extinction Event and Shadows' Verdict while ramping with Cultivate and Omen of the Sea to cast powerful spells like Alrund's Epiphany and Sea Gate Restoration. Using a combination of removal, counterspells, and card advantage, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast its opponents.

The main focus of this deck is to build a powerful board presence with aggressive creatures like Goldspan Dragon, Lovestruck Beast, and Bonecrusher Giant. The inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion enhances the deck's damage output. The deck also includes card draw with Edgewall Innkeeper and ways to protect your creatures with Brazen Borrower and counterspells like Mystical Dispute and Saw It Coming. The Great Henge provides additional card draw and life gain, while Alrund's Epiphany allows for extra turns to keep up the pressure on your opponent.

This Dimir Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with evasive threats like Merfolk Windrobber and Thieves' Guild Enforcer, while disrupting the opponent's strategy with counter spells like Disdainful Stroke and Didn't Say Please. Zareth San, the Trickster serves as a powerful finisher, stealing spells from the opponent's graveyard. Drown in the Loch and Into the Story provide card advantage and removal, while Shark Typhoon creates flying tokens for additional pressure. The deck utilizes a mix of efficient creatures and versatile spells to maintain tempo and close out games swiftly.

The main idea of this deck is to apply relentless pressure on the opponent using fast and efficient creatures, along with burn spells to clear a path to victory. By playing aggressively and making use of cards that boost damage output, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and secure a win before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of snow lands and Faceless Haven also provide additional versatility and potential for extra damage. Overall, this deck is all about speed, aggression, and efficiency in dealing damage.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing powerful removal spells and counterspells to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also includes versatile threats like Vorinclex and Elder Gargaroth to pressure the opponent and generate value. The inclusion of Emergent Ultimatum allows the player to search for key cards to further solidify their control over the game. The mana base is designed to ensure consistency and enable the player to cast their spells efficiently. Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional value by blinking permanents for extra card advantage and utility.

The key concept of this Sultai Control deck is to use a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The deck focuses on generating card advantage with Yorion, Sky Nomad and Emergent Ultimatum, as well as ramping into powerful threats like Elder Gargaroth. By efficiently dealing with threats and setting up powerful plays with cards like Cultivate and Shadows' Verdict, the deck aims to stabilize the board and win the game through incremental advantage and powerful finishers.

Utilize cycling cards to quickly build up a board presence and deal damage to the opponent quickly. Use cards like Rielle, the Everwise and Irencrag Pyromancer to take advantage of cycling, while also utilizing Zenith Flare as a finisher. Valiant Rescuer and Flourishing Fox provide early aggression, while cards like Improbable Alliance and Boon of the Wish-Giver help to maintain card advantage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and creatures, focusing on efficiency and speed to secure victory before the opponent can stabilize.

The main idea behind this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and quickly reduce their life total to zero. By utilizing powerful red creatures like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Anax, Hardened in the Forge, along with strong equipment like Embercleave, the goal is to create a fast-paced and relentless assault. Frost Bite provides additional removal, while Faceless Haven and Castle Embereth help to push through additional damage. Overall, this deck aims to win the game quickly and efficiently through aggressive attacks and powerful synergies.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements such as counterspells, removal, and card draw to outvalue and outlast opponents. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for a longer game plan with a 80-card deck size. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy, control the board with removal spells, and generate card advantage through cards like Behold the Multiverse and Mazemind Tome. Finishers like Koma, Cosmos Serpent and Shark Typhoon provide ways to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's plans with a variety of removal spells and counterspells. It utilizes powerful threats like Vorinclex and Elder Gargaroth to apply pressure while generating card advantage with cards like Mazemind Tome and Sea Gate Restoration. Emergent Ultimatum allows the player to search for game-winning combos or answers to the opponent's board state. The deck also ramps up its mana with Cultivate and Wolfwillow Haven to cast high-impact spells like Alrund's Epiphany and Shadows' Verdict.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and out-valuing opponents through card advantage and versatile removal spells. It aims to stabilize the game with powerful threats like Elder Gargaroth, Valki, and Yorion, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal. The deck also has a ramp package with cards like Cultivate and Wolfwillow Haven to ensure it can cast its high-cost spells like Emergent Ultimatum and Alrund's Epiphany. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the three-color combination of black, green, and blue.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using a variety of removal spells and counterspells to disrupt the opponent's plans. It also includes powerful threats like Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider and Elder Gargaroth to close out the game. The deck utilizes Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to provide additional value by flickering permanents. With a strong mana base and card draw spells like Cultivate and Emergent Ultimatum, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and secure victory through efficient control and powerful threats.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful spells, utilizing the synergy between the cards to create a fast-paced and efficient strategy. The inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion enhances the damage output of the deck, making it even more threatening to the opponent. By maintaining a balance between creatures and spells, the deck aims to maintain tempo and pressure throughout the game, ultimately leading to a quick victory through aggressive plays and smart decision-making.

The main idea behind this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle. By utilizing powerful creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Lovestruck Beast, along with efficient removal spells like Fire Prophecy and Mystical Dispute, the deck aims to maintain board control and pressure the opponent. Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast serves as a key card to cheat out powerful threats like Koma, Cosmos Serpent. The deck also includes some card advantage engines like Edgewall Innkeeper to ensure that the player never runs out of resources.
